column4: guys, can someone tell me what happened to the "World Clock Applet" that integrated into the clock on the panel? Not seen since 11.04 install.  https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardyHeron/Beta#World_Clock_Applet
i think it's gone with the wind
gone?
wanna install it, but not sure its exact name
11.04 which is why I don't have it
I'm in ubuntu classic
no it isn't
there is a clock but not the option in the drop down menu to add other world location times
are you in 11.04 and seeing this?
strange I do not have it.
I thought if I could get the name of that component/applet I could go and install it from synaptic. But can't get the name
lol - yes :D
i did yesterday a fresh install of OS and it's there as always... what you have in time date and settings?
I'm going to reboot and see if that helps
that didn't help. I'm surprised that you have it. Can you see in synaptics what it might be called, please?
this is the option that I now see when I click on the panel clock - http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/853/clockik.png/
you have to click on clock
I have been using gnome for a long time. What used to be there isn't. the clock option only allows me to set and configure the clock
no, Can you give me the name so I can fetch it fromsynaptic?
I want this: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardyHeron/Beta#World_Clock_Applet
if I click on clock I get two options. 1) Add an event (which launches Evolution).  (2) Time and Date Settings, which when I click on it opens the dialog which I showed you a screenshot of.

do notice the applet you are refering is from ubuntu 8 and there has being some ontegration since then, it's under clock as trism said and also another way to access and configure it is on the clock tab at the rigth hand fomr the screen shot you send
